alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 20 at 1:20PM MST until February 20 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY UNTIL 7 PM FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT MONDAY FROM 10 AM THROUGH 7 PM FOR LOCALES ALONG AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Increasing winds in combination with very dry conditions and fuels, above normal readings, and an unstable atmosphere will create several hours of critical fire weather conditions across the east central plains of New Mexico. Expect winds to increase even further for Monday, allowing for a broad region of critical fire weather conditions along and east of the central mountains below significant snowpack. Brief critical conditions could also develop across southern Socorro County, but fuels may not be as susceptible for rapid fire growth in this region. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM MST MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 7 PM MST Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the East Central Plains late this morning through early evening and again late Monday morning through early Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly 15 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 35 or 40 mph today. Southwesterly 25 to 35 mph with gusts near 45 mph on Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum between 8 and 13 percent each day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning for Sunday and Monday.
